flawed_nl_solution:
Marge used half the $12006 for taxes, so she had 12006 / 2 = $<<12006/2=6030>>6030 left.
She used 1/3 of the leftover money on student loans, so she paid 6030 / 3 = $<<6030/3=2010>>2010.
After paying the student loans, she had 6030 - 2010 = $<<6030-2010=4020>>4020 left.
She put $1000 in savings, so she had 4020 - 1000 = $<<4020-1000=3020>>3020 left.
She invested 1000 / 5 = $<<1000/5=200>>200 in the stock market.
After investing, she had 3020 - 200 = $<<3020-200=2820>>2820 left for fun.
#### 2820

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 6003, not 6030. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
